primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God provides a future and identity to a people oppressed by a superpower by fulfilling 'impossibilities' rooted in ancient promises.

tekstueel_bewijs: I blessed him and made him many
God has not quit on Jerusalem
God gave a future to this old couple
my deliverance will never be ended

zender.identificatie: The God of the Promise (The Ancient Quarry)
tekstueel_bewijs: the rock from which you were carved
the story from which you sprang
the sons of Sarah and the daughters of Abraham
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer is invited to identify as the Receiver of the promise, though often urged to act as a Subject of 'remembering'.

helper.rol_van_god: God is the primary Subject; the Spirit is implied through the 'awakening' of memory.
helper.rol_van_geest: External help through the 'Word' that stands forever.

tekstueel_bewijs: superpowers do not believe in God’s impossibilities
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just a bad habit but an all-encompassing system that 'forecloses promises' and 'nullifies hope'.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer must 'remember' and 'look' to the rock to maintain identity in the empire.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Hearer/Believer
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The human action of 'remembering' is the response to God's primary action of 'promising'.

voorbeelden_god_subject: God gave a future to this old couple.
God will restore and recover and rehabilitate the holy city.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: You might forget who you are.
We are authorized to be in the world differently.

voorbeelden: The poet wants to remind the Jews.
We know who we are because we know the story.
God’s rescue will not pass away.
We are authorized to be in the world differently.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on 'Knowing/Remembering' (Savoir) as the key to 'Being Able' (Pouvoir) to resist the empire. It is an epistemological grace.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Empire) to ~S1 (Forgetfulness) to S1 (The Rock/Promise).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by the 'Big Adversative' (BUT), where God's eternal salvation outlasts the vanishing heavens/earth.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. The superpower is described as all-encompassing and ruthless.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is fundamentally theocentric. While it issues imperatives ('Look', 'Remember'), these are grounded in God's prior and ongoing action (The Rock).

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Focus on human effort to 'not lose balance'
indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: You negotiate in your heart about maintaining your freedom.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as the actor of the impossible
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: God gave a future to this old couple who had no future.
My salvation will be forever... it will outlast every calculation of violence.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Abraham and Sarah are not used as moral examples of 'how to be good,' but as evidence of God's ability to work miracles from 'nothing'.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: 'God saves like He saved Abraham'.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief and re-orientation; moving from anxiety to 'equilibrium'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The link between the Old Testament 'Rock' and the New Testament 'Rock' is structurally seamless.
spanning_punten: The tension between 'getting along' in the empire and 'claiming identity'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: God’s purpose of well-being will override the aggressive superpowers.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The 'Word' and 'Memory' act as the endowment of power.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: High; sin is seen as the 'stupor' and 'anxiety' induced by the Empire.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully positions God as the Subject of the primary narrative program (Salvation) and the hearer as the Receiver who is then empowered to be a Subject in the secondary program (Resistance/Memory).

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Explicitly mention how the Holy Spirit enables the 'remembering' when the empire's pressure is too great.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A masterclass in theocentric preaching that avoids moralism by rooting human identity in the 'impossibility' of God's historical and eternal action.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the 'Rock' metaphor, Greimas shows that the Rock is a 'Sender' of values that redefines the 'Subject'.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Babylonian context; semiotics explains how that context functions as an 'Opponent' to the hearer's 'Object' of identity.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Reveals that the 'Superpower' is a narrative actant that functions by attempting to strip the Subject of its 'Savoir-faire' (Memory).

volledige_subject_lijst: God (blessed, made, will comfort, will restore, names, hopes, says)
The People (seek, look, remember, count on, watch)
appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Big Adversative' (But) as the pivot point for the Subject-switch from Empire to God.
